question.name: 1-1_EQ1
question.text: Target housing addressed by the RRP Rule is a home or residential unit built before 1978, with some exceptions.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 1-1_EQ2
question.text: Exceptions to the definition of target housing covered by the RRP Rule includes 1-bedroom and 0-bedroom dwellings as well as housing designated for the elderly.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 1-2_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following criteria is correct regarding a “Child-Occupied Facility” as defined by the RRP Rule?
question.choices: Building is pre-1960|May be located in a public or commercial building such as a school or daycare center|Visited regularly by same child less than 3 years old|Visits are at least 4 days per week

question.name: 1-2_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following criteria is NOT correct regarding a “Child-Occupied Facility” as defined by the RRP Rule?
question.choices: May be located in a public building such as a school|Visited regularly by same child less than 3|Visits are at least two different days per week|Combined weekly visits are at least 6 hours

question.name: 1-3_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following situations requires that the RRP Rule be followed?
question.choices: A lead inspection showed no lead present in the home|An exterior job disturbing less than 20 ft2 of paint on a side of a house|Work done for free|Interior work disturbing greater than 6 ft2 of surface containing lead-based paint in a room

question.name: 1-3_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following situations requires that the RRP Rule be followed?
question.choices: An exterior job disturbing greater than 20 ft2 i.e., of surface containing lead-based paint on a side of a house|An emergency renovation|No lead present in components being worked on |Minor repair or maintenance activities

question.name: 1-5_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of a Certified Firm?
question.choices: Ensure all recordkeeping requirements are being met for each job |Ensure that work is conducted following practices specified in the Rule|Ensure that all renovation personnel are trained in lead-safe work practices|Have all employees trained as Certified Renovators

question.name: 1-5_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of a Certified Firm?
question.choices: Keep all records of pre-renovation education documentation|Assign a Certified Renovator to each job|Inform EPA of all jobs conducted under RRP Rule|Obtain and maintain firm certification

question.name: 1-6_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of a Certified Renovator?
question.choices: Train non-certified workers in lead-safe work practices |Remain onsite during all stages of renovation job including setup, work, and cleaning|Maintain copies of current training certificates onsite|Use EPA-recognized test kits to identify lead-based paint

question.name: 1-6_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of a Certified Renovator?
question.choices: Oversee trained workers implementing cleaning verification procedure|Remain onsite during sign posting, work area preparation, and clean up|Ensure containment is maintained to prevent spread of dust and debris|Perform work and direct work of non-certified renovators

question.name: 1-7_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is a requirement of the Pre-Renovation Education (PRE) rule?
question.choices: Renovation workers must be educated regarding lead-safe work practices|Renovation firms must obtain certification from EPA |Training providers must become certified to teach the Initial Renovator training course|Certified renovation firms must distribute the Renovate Right pamphlet to the owner of pre-1978 homes being renovated

question.name: 1-7_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding distribution of the Renovate Right pamphlet under the Pre-Renovation Education (PRE) rule?
question.choices: When working in rental units, the pamphlet does not need to be given to the tenants|The pamphlet must be distributed not more than 60 days prior to beginning a renovation|Acknowledgement of receipt must be obtained at least 7 days prior to beginning a renovation |Let parents or guardians of children using a child-occupied facility know about the renovation and how to get a copy of the pamphlet

question.name: 1-8_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an area of difference between the RRP Rule and HUD’s Lead-Safe Housing Rule?
question.choices: Clearance testing following renovation work|De minimis levels (amount of paint that has to be disturbed before rule is in effect)|Use of power sanders without HEPA attachment|Use of dry scraping to remove paint

question.name: 1-8_EQ2
question.text: “De minimis” levels under HUD’s Lead Safe Housing Rule are smaller than those in the RRP Rule, i.e., a smaller area affected by work requires following of lead-safe work practices in the rule.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 2-1_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a type of testing that can determine if lead is present in paint?
question.choices: Paint chip sampling and testing |EPA-recognized test kit |X-Ray Fluorescence|Visual inspection of paint

question.name: 2-1_EQ2
question.text: Certified Renovators must use a lead test kit as well as collect a paint chip sample for lead analysis to determine the presence of lead-based paint prior to the start of renovation activities.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 2-2_EQ1
question.text: After testing for lead-based paint, a Certified Firm does not have to report the results to the client.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 2-2_EQ2
question.text: When paint chip samples are obtained by a Certified Renovator, the Certified Firm must provide a report to the client within ____days after completion of the renovation.

question.name: 3-1_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following are interior containment requirements of the RRP Rule?
question.choices: Close windows and doors in the work area|Close and seal HVAC vents|Use disposable tack pad at edge of plastic|All of the above

question.name: 3-1_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an interior containment requirement of the RRP Rule?
question.choices: Keep food in work area to reduce tracking of dust from work area|Post a warning sign at entry to work area|Cover immovable objects with plastic|Cover floors at least 6 feet from work area

question.name: 3-2_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for exterior containment?
question.choices: Work in windy conditions to help disperse dust created|Close all windows and doors within 20 feet of the work area|Cover the ground with plastic at least 10 feet from work area|Cover access doors in work area with two layers of plastic

question.name: 3-2_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an extra precaution to take to prevent spread of dust during exterior work?
question.choices: Use vertical containment in windy conditions |Extend area of ground covered if working on second story |Use vertical containment when adjacent properties are close to work area|Do not cover grass with plastic so that dust can settle in ground

question.name: 4-1_EQ1
question.text: Which one of the following practices for removing lead-based paint is NOT prohibited under the RRP rule?
question.choices: Open-flame burning|Heat gun above 1,100° F|Sanding by hand|Abrasive blasting without the use of HEPA vacuum attachments

question.name: 4-1_EQ2
question.text: Heat gun removal above 1,100° F, open flame burning, and torching for removal of lead-based paint are prohibited because they produce lead contaminated dust particulates which can be ingested into the lungs and left behind in a work area.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-2_EQ1
question.text: When transporting waste from the renovation work area it must be contained to prevent the release of dust and debris.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-2_EQ2
question.text: When cleaning the work site workers must maintain a completely spotless site in order to control the level of dust and debris.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-3_EQ1
question.text: It is NOT necessary for workers to wear a respirator as long as they are wearing other protective gear such as coveralls and hat.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-3_EQ2
question.text: Personal protection must be worn at all times including the planning, testing, and setup phases of the work.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-4_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of effective cleanup?
question.choices: Clean top to bottom, from top of wall to window to floor|Clean all surfaces|Clean floors in work room before cleaning other surfaces in room|Keep dust from spreading to areas that were already cleaned

question.name: 4-4_EQ2
question.text: Clean floors of the work area first so that dust is NOT tracked around while cleaning other areas.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 4-5_EQ1
question.text: When leaving the containment area which of the following actions should be taken to prevent the spread of lead-contaminated dust?
question.choices: HEPA vacuum shoes|HEPA vacuum and remove disposable coveralls and shoe covers|Wash hands and face|All of the above

question.name: 4-5_EQ2
question.text: If leaving the work site for only a few minutes, there is no need to take steps to prevent the spread of lead-contaminated dust such as removing shoe covers and disposable coveralls.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-1_EQ1
question.text: Paint chips and debris should be sealed in heavy-duty plastic bags.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-1_EQ2
question.text: When doing interior cleaning, the floor should be cleaned first.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-2_EQ1
question.text: In checking clean-up work, special attention should be paid to which of the following?
question.choices: Window sills|Bare Soil|Children’s Play areas|All of the above

question.name: 5-2_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an acceptable practice for exterior clean-up?
question.choices: Dry rake and shovel |Mist sheeting|Dispose of protective sheeting as waste|Inspect the plastic after cleaning for dust and debris

question.name: 5-3_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT true during the cleaning verification process?
question.choices: After wiping a designated area, the cloth should be lighter in color than the cleaning verification card|After wiping a designated area, if the cloth is darker in color than the cleaning verification card, the area needs further cleaning|The first cloths used should be dry|The cloth should be disposable

question.name: 5-3_EQ2
question.text: Surfaces to be tested during the Cleaning Verification include which of the following?
question.choices: Window Sills|Countertops|Floors|All of the above

question.name: 5-4_EQ1
question.text: The Visual Inspection procedure can be conducted by a trained non-certified renovator.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-4_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT part of the Visual Inspection procedure?
question.choices: Work from the area farthest from the entry back to the entry|It must be performed by a Certified Renovator|Ensure there is adequate lighting|Identify visible paint chips on floors only

question.name: 5-5_EQ1
question.text: Dust clearance testing is required by HUD in many pre-1978 properties receiving Federal housing assistance.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-5_EQ2
question.text: If post-work clearance testing fails, the renovation firm must re-clean the work area until dust standards comply with applicable state, territorial, tribal, and local standards.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-6_EQ1
question.text: At the conclusion of a renovation, waste that has been collected from renovation activities must be stored under containment, in an enclosure, or behind a barrier that prevents release of dust and debris out of the work area.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 5-6_EQ2
question.text: Which of the following is an example of hazardous waste that may be generated at a worksite?
question.choices: Protective sheeting|Solid components with no peeling paint|Vacuum debris|Rugs & Carpets

question.name: 6-1_EQ1
question.text: Renovation records must be maintained for 3 years following completion of a renovation.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 6-1_EQ2
question.text: The EPA may request records for renovations for up to ______ following completion of a renovation.
question.choices: 30 days|6 months|3 years|7 years

question.name: 6-2_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following documents must be maintained ONSITE during performance of a job?
question.choices: Paint testing results|Copy of Certified Renovator Initial training certificate|Copy of Certified Renovator Refresher training certificate|A copy of a Certified Renovator Initial training certificate and a copy of a Certified Renovator Refresher training certificate

question.name: 6-2_EQ2
question.text: Which documentation must be maintained ONSITE for each job?
question.choices: Copy of Firm Certification |Receipts for lead-safe renovation materials|Proof of owner-occupant pre-renovation education|None of the above

question.name: 6-3_EQ1
question.text: If dust clearance sampling is performed in lieu of a clearance verification, a copy of the dust sampling report must be provided within 30 days of renovation completion to the person who contracted for the renovation.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 6-3_EQ2
question.text: If an EPA-recognized test kit is used to test surfaces, the firm must submit a report within 30 days with which of the following?
question.choices: Make and model of EPA test kit|Description and location |Results of the test|All of the above

question.name: 6-4_EQ1
question.text: The Post-Renovation report serves to document all aspects of lead-safe work practices by the Certified Renovator and other workers onsite while working on a particular renovation.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 6-4_EQ2
question.text: The Post-Renovation report should include which of the following?
question.choices: Documentation of training for Certified and non-certified renovators|A description of work area and waste containment|Proof of successful cleaning verification|All of the above

question.name: 7-1_EQ1
question.text: If Certified Renovator is NOT onsite, availability via telephone is acceptable.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 7-1_EQ2
question.text: Training of non-certified renovators can take place in which of the following ways?
question.choices: On the Job|Classroom with hands-on practice|Provided by a third party who is also a Certified Renovator|All of the above

question.name: 7-2_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following activities can a trained non-certified renovation worker do?
question.choices: Post warning signs without supervision|Cleaning Verification|Determine if lead-based paint is present|Wear personal protective equipment

question.name: 7-2_EQ2
question.text: The trained non-certified renovator can do all of the following except:
question.choices: Determine if lead-based paint is present|Wear personal protective equipment such as safety goggles and shoe covers|Keep the work area clean to prevent the spread of dust|Dispose of waste water with a waste disposal company

question.name: 7-3_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following documents is the primary resource that a Certified Renovator should use to train non-certified renovators?
question.choices: US Department of Housing and Urban Development guidelines|State and Local regulations|Small Entity compliance Guide to Renovate Right|Steps to LEAD SAFE Renovation, Repair, and Painting

question.name: 7-3_EQ2
question.text: The Renovate Right pamphlet is the best guide for Certified Renovators to train non-certified renovators.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 7-4_EQ1
question.text: Which of the following activities does not contribute to Step 4: Control the Spread of Dust?
question.choices: Avoid blocking the work room door so dust does not concentrate in one room|Vacuum suits when exiting work area|Use tack pads to keep shoes clean |Wrap components securely when removing

question.name: 7-4_EQ2
question.text: A trained non-certified renovation worker is responsible for at least 4 of the 7 steps to lead-safe practices including: protect self, control spread dust, leave work area clean, and control waste.
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 7-5_EQ1
question.text: The RRP rule requires that documentation on training non-certified workers be maintained including which worker has which training, a list of all training topics covered for each worker, and a signature of the Certified Renovator who did the training.\r
question.choices: True|False

question.name: 7-5_EQ2
question.text: After the job is complete, documentation of training for the trained non-certified renovation worker can be thrown away.
question.choices: True|False
